data.title: Hewlett Packard Company Acquires Tabblo, A Photo Template Network Site
data.meta_description: Tabblo, a social network where users can upload photos and integrate stylish templates along with those photos has announced today that they are being acquired by Hewlett-Packard. Hewlett Packard’s appeal in the purchase was fueled particularly by Tabblo’s large network of 150 thousand tabblos (users) and 5 million uploaded photos. The company started in May […]
data.text:
Tabblo, a social network where users can upload photos and integrate stylish templates along with those photos has announced today that they are being acquired by Hewlett-Packard.

Hewlett Packard’s appeal in the purchase was fueled particularly by Tabblo’s large network of 150 thousand tabblos (users) and 5 million uploaded photos. The company started in May 2006.

Founded by Antonio Rodriguez, Tabblo.com, will stick around and will be applying new technologies as a result of the acquisition. HP also owns Snapfish.com, which is also a photo-sharing website. Tabblo and Snapfish will remain independent of each other.

“Tabblo is a very cool company with a great product. They’ve got Flickr-like community, they blogged critically about Yahoo while sponsoring Techmeme and I’ll tell you – I often show off the Tabblo of the kids in my family to people who visit my house. Naysayers called them an also-ran but they deserve a big congrats today” stated Marshall Kirkpatrick, Director of Content at SplashCast.

The announcement was made official by the Tabblog.
